tabs.label: Obtaining Criminal Records
tabs.desc: To apply for expungement, you'll need detailed information about your criminal history:

list.title: Local Law Enforcement
list.description: Contact the police department where you were arrested for arrest records and charges.

list.title: County Court Records
list.description: Reach out to the Superior Court in the county of your conviction for court documents, including docket numbers and case dispositions.

list.title: New Jersey State Police
list.description: Request a comprehensive criminal history record, which may require submitting fingerprints.

tabs.label: Fingerprinting for Expungement
tabs.desc: Fingerprinting may be necessary to confirm your identity:

list.title: Schedule an Appointment
list.description: Use an approved fingerprinting service authorized by the New Jersey State Police.

list.title: Submit Fingerprints
list.description: Your fingerprints will be taken electronically and submitted to the state police.

list.title: Obtain a Receipt
list.description: Include the fingerprinting receipt with your expungement petition.

list.title: Offense or Charges
list.description: Specific charges and related statute numbers.

list.title: Case Outcome
list.description: Dispositions such as guilty, not guilty, or dismissed.

list.title: Sentence Completion Proof
list.description: Documentation of completed jail time, probation, or fines paid.
